Leaves: Alternate, fixed to stem, irregularly toothed, hairless, up to 15 cm long.
Flowers: Typical daisy flowerheads with pink rays and yellow centre, in a flat-topped grouping at the end of the stems.
FruitSeeds: 2-3 mm long, with parachuting hairs 7-9 mm long.
Habitat: Disturbed sites, agricultural land, woodlands, coastal areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: The attractive pink flowerheads are unusual among Groundsels (*Senecio* species).
